Analogy Casey could share with Pat for his COPD diagnosis:
In this case, Casey can use the following analogy to help Pat understand, visualize, and discuss his COPD diagnosis. This approach aligns with the principle of awareness and also supports effective communication, as it demonstrates personal connection and empathy from Casey:

"Pat, think of your lungs as a car engine - they need oxygen to run properly. With COPD, your engine struggles to get the oxygen it needs to run efficiently, which can cause it to wear down more quickly. By taking care of your lungs and making lifestyle changes, you can provide your engine with the fuel it needs to keep running smoothly and prevent further damage."
